author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves blocking email communication from specific senders that are identified as malicious or potentially harmful. This is a critical containment measure to prevent phishing attacks, spam, and other malicious activities that can compromise the security of the organization. It can be implemented through email filtering systems, firewalls, or other network security measures that inspect incoming email traffic and block messages from specified senders.

requirements.description: Authority and access permissions to implement containment measures.
Technical capability and tools to execute containment actions effectively.
Procedures to validate containment effectiveness and monitor for bypass attempts.

title: Block Email Sender

references.name: Network Security Controls and Traffic Filtering
NIST SP 800-41 Rev. 1: Guidelines for Firewall and Network Security
